1.content:
Zuko was sitting at a table with a red suit on beside his wife Mai. She was in an elegant black dress with a ruby necklace and red thin silk scarf. She had her two side tails as per usual, only she had two gold hair jewelry pieces. They were 2 inch long gold hoops with rubies with hair pulled through them and tied into a braid under the hoops to keep them in place. Mai smiled as she had a hand on his as he took a sip from a spoon that had soup from his bowl. Mai just sat there with a smile as she looked across the table.
Song sat eating her salad wearing a green dress that had a left quarter long sleeve. She wore a white chocker made of silk. Her elbow long white gloves were lovely. Her hair was pulled into a tail pulled into a pony tail with the hair pulled from the middle of the scalp. Giving a clear view to her bronze hair jewelry of a half inch long hoop with emerald in the shape of a disc on the hair jewelry hoop.
Katara sat at the table popping a grape into her mouth. She wore a shoulderless light blue dress with the dress hanging onto her cleavage giving plenty of view. She wore her hair in her normal style only on her hair loopies were a pair of hair jewelry pieces that were a series of silver rings with sapphire stones on them held by a chain to slide on the hair loopies without damaging them.
And at the table were the last two women. Meng was sitting with her green Chinese dress on with gold line art of flower petals blowing into the wind with crawling badger moles. She had a diamond cut out on her cleavage. On her right wrist was a gold border green cloth tied on.
Jin was wearing a puffy yellow tank top with bicep sleeves that were shoulderless. She wore a green skirt and had her hair long with the hair brushed straight.
Aang was sitting at the table as well wearing a yellow suit with white under shirt. He smiled as Zuko then stood up and tapped his glass. The restaurant got quiet as the girls and boys at the table stopped eating.
Zuko then smiled as he reached for a small box by his soup. He then picked up th ered velvet box. He walked over to Jin who blushed and began to shake with raw nerves. Smiling Song reached over to hold the girl's hand to help her to stop from shaking. Zuko then opened the box to show a black metal hair jewelry hoop. It was an inch and half long with three topazes going down in a line. Song stood up as she went to Zuko's chair. Zuko then took a seat as he asked her sitting across from Jing.
Zuko then asked her the question, “Jin, could you honor me with marriage?”
Crying into her hand she then said with a squeal, “Ye-yes! YES!”
She then hugged him in a full tackle. Two spikes of earth came out of the floor as Iroh sighed. He then looked at Haru as the young man earth bent the floor back into place.
The other girls at the table were clapping as Aang then lifted a glass. Everyone stopped as they waited for him to say something, “To the soon to be happy groom and bride, merry marriage asking day!”
People clapped and people cheered as girls congratulated Jin on her proposal.
Sokka was in a long blue trench coat. He had on a black belt with his sword attached. He put on a hat as he pulled on a pair gloves. He wrapped a scarf around his neck as he grabbed a flower. Sokka began to walk to the front door.
He was stopped by Suki's voice as she asked him, “When Sokka?”
Sokka stopped as he then turned to her, “You know when.”
Suki then nodded as she stood up. She then went up to him as she pulled his scarf tighter and tucked it into his coat. She then said to him, “11, we have brunch with the girls.”
Sokka nodded as he kissed her on the lips. He then walked out the door as he braved the cold morning. The sun was just above the horizon with the sky beginning to light up as he made his way out.
Inside the mansion he had exited a girl throwing up was heard as Suki went to find out who it was. She came to a door as she opend it to see Azula in her red night gown throwing up into the toilet. Suki then went over and stoked her back as she grabbed her hair holding it back. Azula let out more as she then coughed and pulled back.
Suki then smiled as Azula then said to her threatening, “Tell him before I do and I'll burn that smirk right off.”
Suki shook her head as she said to Azula, “Of course not.”
Sokka was at the front of a hospital as he walked inside. He walked to an elevator after checking in. He waited until the elevator took him to the third floor and he walked down the coma ward. He came to a bed that had one of the most beautiful girls in it. It was Yue with her long hair tied into her elegant hair loopies. They were long now and a little unkept.
Sokka sat down by her bed as he took her hair and undid the fancy elegant braids to her hair loopies. He began to brush her hair as he moved her and then he began to tie her hair into braids. He then said to her as a couple of tears came to his eyes, “I miss you Yue, I really do.”
FIRE FIRE FIRE FIRE FIRE
Zuko groaned as he felt something good on him. He felt wet as he then woke up and saw a large round bump in the blanket. He then pulled up as he saw Jin as she licked him. She then smiled at him and said with a lustful smile, “Oh, hi Zuko, I hope you don't mind if I continue the celebration from last night some more?”
Zuko grinned as he said to her, “Of course not.”
Jin then smiled as she went back to licking and eating as Zuko reclined back. He heard her slurp on her morning meal as he then heard a knock. He groaned as he then said with a strained voice, “Can it wait?”
The door opened with Mai walking in as she said to him, “We have a brunch to go to in an hour. I suggest that you finish the morning snack before going to brunch with the rest of us. Also, try to wear something casual, but not too casual.”
Mai then left the room as Zuko groaned and shook. He was red in the face as he let out large pants of red flame from his mouth. He gripped his hands into fists as he tried to control himself. Suddenly, he let out a long and loud moan as his flame change from red to yellow with red surrounding it. He then hit the bed as the flame became small bursts. He then sighed as sweat was coming from him.
Mai smiled softly as she said to Jin, “I see you can't resist finding the P-Spot either.”
Jin then crawled out from under the blanket as she whiped her mouth with a gulp. She then said with a smile, “Nope.”
Mai then pointed at the corner of her own lip as she said to Jin, “You left some.”
Jin then licked the outside of her lips as she got up the frosting from breakfast. Jin then walked out with a shake as she said to him, “I'm going to go get dressed Zuko.”
Mai then said looking back at him, “She's done it now.”
Zuko asked still reeling back from his morning work out, “Done what?”
Mai said walking out with a grin and shake, “Get revved up for tonight lover boy.”
On Ji was wearing her red hoodie and gold short shorts. She took a gulp of her water as she then began to run again. She then put the cap on the water bottle as she then ran down the steps. She enjoyed the park outside her apartment.
But, what she enjoyed even more was seeing her boyfriend. She smiled as she then ran up to Aang who sat on a bench. He had her favorite morning snack, blueberry frosted donuts. Oh, what did she do for the universe to deserve such a handsome and perfect man.
Aang stood up as he smiled at her as she came to a stop. She then took one of the offered donuts. She bit on it as she ate it slowly. Aang hugged On Ji as the two smiled and enjoyed the hug. Aang then asked her as he put the box away in his bag, “You ready for brunch?”
On Ji nervous then shook her head as she said to him, “No, but I am tired of waiting to meet your family. So, let's go.”
Smiling Aang then put his arm around her shoulder as the pair began to walk.
Sokka took off his trench coat as he walked into a Jasmine Dragon. He wore a black class b shirt with his blue uniform slacks. He walked over to the table with Zuko, Mai, Ty Lee, Katara, Suki, Meng, Jin, Song, Toph, Azula and Kaya. Sokka smiled as he pulled out a chair after bending over giving kisses to Kaya, Azula, Suki and Ty Lee.

11.content:
Walking in was Aang with On Ji as he smiled at the boys and girls. Aang then introduced On Ji, “Everyone, this is On Ji. On Ji, this is my family.”

Everyone smiled as they greeted her and introduced themselves individually. On Ji was slightly shocked when she heard that Katara, Toph and Meng were all Aang's girlfriend or wife. Sokka then said to her as he took a piece of bacon, “He's an Air Nomad, that's how they are. Multiple partners in life and all, and trust me he won't mind if you sleep with someone else either. We're all pretty open here, heck me and Zuko had that homo phase six years ago.”

Zuko looking mad said to, “I thought we said we'd never bring it up again.”

Mai then said to him just so he would hear, “No fair, you said that I would get that kind of action for my birthday.”

Zuko said to her, “Me and Sokka will, but let's not talk about it in front of the tyro.”

Nodding in understanding Mai then kissed him as she out loud said to cover up the private conversation, “I love you too, Zuko.”
Zuko stroked her cheek as she then nuzzled his neck. On Ji was very surprised by all the emotions going on. Ty Lee and Suki were holding hands as they smiled. Jin was obviously doing something naughty to Song as she was holding back moans. On Ji could not believe what was going on. Then she saw Aang kiss Katara as he went over to Toph and kissed her.

On Ji finally sat down as everyone ate from the large plates of meat, eggs, pancakes, burgers and biscuits. Waiters and waitresses came to fill tea as they all talked. On Ji eventually got comfortable with the situation and even was talking with Katara. The more experienced partner flirted with her saying that the short shorts were really cute on her. On Ji blushed at the compliment as she had commented on Katara's medium heels and how they looked good on her. The two had to go shopping some time so they could be girly Toph complained making everyone laugh.

Azula then decided it was time as she stood up. Everyone quieted down as she then coughed. Sokka looked at her expectantly as he waited for what she had to say. He waited for her to be comfortable and then she began to talk, “Everyone, I would like to say on everyone's behalf. That we are happy to welcome On Ji as a new member to our little family. And hope that she stays with us.”

Everyone smiled and said here here. Azula continued as she then said to the group, “On a similar note, I would like to make a special announcement. About a month ago it was Sokka and my anniversary, our third anniversary. And I would like to say that thanks to Ty Lee's help, me and Sokka celebrated it like we should have. We were going through a small rough patch with being pressured by my body. We just have been working so hard for the last year and I would like to tell you all that our hard work has paid off. As we all agreed when we started this community, that any and all children would be considered ours. No one would be father or mother, we all would. And so, Sokka my lovely husband, Zuko my brother and Aang my husband's best friend. Mai my sister that I never was born with, Ty Lee my best friend, Suki my fellow wife, Jin my girlfriend, Katara my frenemy, Meng, Kaya, Song and Toph that are my friends. I'd like to let you know that you will all be mommies and daddies 8 months from now.”
Everyone cheered and toasted as Sokka then smiled. He literally ran on top of the table as he leaped at her. She screamed in a fun manner as Suki and Ty Lee caught him. The four hugged and were joined by Kaya. Everyone with the exception of On Ji gave hugs and congratulations all around. Sokka then lifted up Azula as she squealed and was lifted into the air onto his shoulders. She then laughed and told him to put her down as he said he would never do that. The moment was memorialized by Iroh taking a picture of the event. Today was the greatest day of their lives.

Now, it is your chance to change the story around. Please pick one of the choices below. Sokka to continue the Sokka route, Zuko to continue Zuko or Aang to continue Aang. Or if you prefer a tri route, please pick number 4. Or if you want to read from the view of author's choice character pick route number 5.

111.content:
Sokka was grinning like a dope as he went back to his bedroom with Azula, Suki, Ty Lee, and Kaya. Aang and Zuko had stayed behind to continue dining with the rest of the girls, but he had just been so excited at the news that Azula was pregnant!

This was wonderful news!

"You're excited," Azula observed, a warm smile on her face. She had mellowed out considerably from her teenage years, and the love of Sokka and the others had done much to help her pull through her various issues.

Ty Lee giggled.

"Of course he is!" she chirped, giving Azula a tight hug and a perhaps-not-entirely-platonic kiss on the cheek. "You're going to have a baby! That's like the best kind of news there is!"

Azula laughed, and she reciprocated Ty Lee's hug and kiss (though the latter was on the lips, as opposed to the cheek).

"Yes," she said, "I suppose it is, isn't it?"

"Of course it is," said Kaya demurely, cheerfully, smiling at the antics of the two best friends and fellow wives. "It means a new addition to our family, a little son or daughter for us all to spoil and dote on."

Suki grinned.

"Yeah," she agreed, joining Ty Lee in giving Azula another congratulatory hug. "We're happy for you."

Sokka smiled at the sight of some of the women he loved the most in the world looking so happy, and he went over and wrapped them all up in a great big bear hug, giving them plenty of playful, affectionate kisses.

"This is one of the happiest days of my life!" he said proudly, with a loud, hearty guffaw, and the girls joined him in revelry.

What happened next?

1113.content:
Sokka's cell phone rang just as Suki was making a move for his zipper. Growling he picked it up and answered the phone, "Yeah, what's up?"

Jet's voice came on the line as he said to Sokka, "Sokka, we got a mission. Usual spot at midnight, bring your full gear. It's going to be a long trip."

Sokka nodded as he said with a sigh, "Yeah, sure."

Sokka then hung up his phone as he said to the girls sadly, "Sorry, girls, that was work. They want me to come in to fix a corporal's mistake on some paper work about me. A Lieutenant's job is never finished."

Azula pouted as she said with a slight whine, "Are you sure? I mean can't you just do it during drill this week end?"

Shaking his head he said to her with a sad response, "Sorry, babe, but be sure to keep the baby safe. Speaking of drill as long as I'm there, I'll just check into the barracks to stay there til drill is over with."

As they walked inside Sokka went to the closet as he opened it. He reached inside to the floor. Lifting it up he saw inside his sword, boomerang, club and jaw bone dagger. He started to get undressed with a hand landed on his shoulder.

11131.content:
Turning around, completely naked from the waist up and his trousers halfway down his legs, Sokka saw that the hand belonged to Ty Lee, who was giving him a rather suggestive smile. Behind her were Azula, Suki, and Kaya, and all of them had a very meaningful sort of expression on their faces.

"For good luck," said Ty Lee with a giggle, giving him a deep kiss on the lips, which Sokka found himself hungrily reciprocating despite the technically urgent nature of his call. Almost against his will, his hands made their way down Ty Lee's back, and they came to rest on the generous curve of her shapely, toned posterior.

She purred into his mouth at the feeling of his large, calloused hands gently, lovingly squeezing her behind, and she pressed herself tightly against him, feeling the hardness of his erection which pressed against her abdomen.

Suki, meanwhile, slipped around past Ty Lee, wrapping her arms around Sokka's bare, toned chest from the sides as she leaned in to plant a kiss on his cheek, even as he continued to kiss Ty Lee. Kaya did similar from the other side of Sokka, though she favored a handful of his firm buttocks -- and when had his underwear come off?

Azula, for her part, pressed into her friend, Ty Lee, from behind, her bosom mashing interestingly into the bubbly girl's back. She playfully nibbled at one of Ty Lee's ears, reaching her hands around and up her friend's blouse to tease her very generous endowments.

Because Sokka had to leave so shortly, they did not have the time to give their husband a proper farewell -- or at least, not the sort to which they had grown accustomed -- but they still gave him a lot to think fondly on when he left to take care of business, and a reason to get done quickly and return home soon.

As it was, Sokka probably should not have lingered so long with his farewell kisses, but the girls made it very hard to leave.

They had a talent for making certain things hard, really.

But ultimately, after a few minutes Sokka did have to finish getting dressed, then leave.

"Don't take too long," said Azula, giving him one last peck on the cheek as he went out the door.

"I won't," he assured her, smiling.

"And don't get hurt, either," said Suki, giving him a sharp, knowing look. Then she added: "I'd never hear the end of it from Yue or Katara, if I didn't tell you that."

Sokka gave her a halfwit grin.

"Of course I won't," he promised. "You know how those two worry."

Then he gave each of the girls one last, lingering kiss on the lips apiece before setting off in the direction of the barracks.

Hopefully there wouldn't be any... complications... with the assignment.

What next?

1113112.content:
"Sokka Mawii’aa on this mission you shall be in charge of getting the prisoner General Jeong Jeong out of the main prison cell. We need the general alive, but if it comes to it kill the general. If you can get another officer or two, get them as well. If not, then don't that is final." These instructions were given by Chey.

Sokka nodded as he then looked at Long Shot, "So, you got my back?"

Long Shot said to him, "Yes."

Chey then said to the pair, "Alright, now, here's what we know about the island. The island we are heading to is the middle of Hurricane Horde territory. Now, the war criminal that is there right now manning the tables is General Hahn Ginebig formerly of the Northern Water Tribe."

Drawing his brows together Sokka said under his breath, "Hahn Ginebig, the Warrior of 700 Waves. He is going down if I run into him. He betrayed and led all 700 warriors of the Northern - Southern Water Tribe alliance's Waves Battalion to their deaths. Many of my good friends died on that mission that he betrayed them for just a cushy job and 4,000 Honor a campaign."

Nodding Chey said to him, "If you can get him, then get him. But, remember, Jeong Jeong is your priority. Now, Admiral Zhao Kwok and Sanjit Manda are not here at Two Headed Fish Island. But, from what we understand there are 3,000 troops here and 14 of their best ships. Among them is the Former Southern Water Tribe Polar Bear Dog class ship, the FIRE QUENCHER. This part of the mission is where Jet and Haru come in. Seeing as the barrel we are going to send the four of you on shall be useless it is your job to come back to friendly waters on the FIRE QUENCHER."

Jet looked to Haru as the pair nodded. Chey then said to the pair, "Alright, the ship is a real morale booster to the boys if we can get it. The White Lotus has had a bad losing streak as of late as you know. The war is looking bad for us, and we need a turn around. So, are you capable of doing it?"

The four then nodded as they then said with a salutes, "Yes sir."
1113112.title: Continue with mission

choices: Going well, for once
It's never that easy
11131121.content:
The journey to the island was neither easy nor short. The waters were rough, and the moon was merely a sliver. It was dark, that night, and for the sake of stealth they had to navigate all but blind.

It took them a number of hours to reach their destination, and only the strict sense of self-disciple that had been drilled into them as members of the White Lotus Special Ops kept the five agents on task. As it was, they were still cold and tired when they finally reached the shore, their small, expendable vessel beaching on a barren, rocky shelf under the cover of night.

Jet was the first to dismount, followed shortly by the others.

"They don't have any guard towers, this side of the island," he observed, tersely, shrewdly.

Longshot glanced back at the waters the came in by, treacherous frothing current swirling and crashing among jagged spires of half-submerged rock.

Haru nodded in agreement with the archer's silent observation.

"Yeah," he said, "I wouldn't expect anyone to be crazy enough to try landing on this shore, either, if I was in their place."

Sokka smirked.

"Crazy is my middle name," he said, tongue in cheek, a wry grin on his face. But then his demeanor hardened, and he glanced sidelong as Sangok.

"Will you be alright?" he asked. "There's not much of a moon, tonight."

The Northerner shrugged off his concern.

"All the better for our purposes," he replied dismissively. "If we do this right, we shouldn't need to be getting into any fights at all."

If they do this right, Sokka could not help but think. And that was a pretty big 'if'.

He then shook his head, glancing over to Jet.

"Well?" he said, but the other man simply shook his head. "You ready?

"Hey, you're the brains of this outfit," the hook-sword wielder responded, smirking.

Sokka nodded, understanding what went unsaid.

I trust you to get us through this.

He glanced at the others, his fellow agents. They all nodded grimly, meeting his gaze with hard, determined eyes.

They were in full operative mode, now.

"Okay, team," Sokka said, his tone becoming crisp and clear as he spoke, curtly, concisely. "You know what to do. Jet, Haru, you have your orders from the head. Longshot, Sangok, I want you two covering me."

They all nodded, once more.

The mission began.

Did Sokka run into any trouble? Or were he, Longshot, and Sangok able to extract Jeong-Jeong without issue and rendezvous with Haru and Jet at the Fire Quencher?
11131121.title: They get in the barrel

choices: Fought their way back up and over the wall
Sokka came up with one of his trademark plans
111311212.content:
Sokka could have cursed, when they were spotted by that first patrol. They were still outside the walls of the main complex where their target was being held, when it happened.

Flames burst to life at his feet, and it was only Sangok's quick reflexes that kept him from getting his boots melted off. The tongues of red and orange and yellow were banished as quickly as they had appeared, quenched in a controlled spurt of water and hissing, billowing steam.

Sangok bent the water that hadn't been evaporated by the flames back into his camel pack, and the steam he deftly re-condensed to join the rest of it.

Additionally, as Sangok had been dousing the flames, Longshot had quickly, intuitively calculated the most likely location of their source from what he had seen of the fireball's trajectory. Even as the illuminating fire vanished in steam and darkness, he swiftly, silently drew his bow and knocked an arrow.

And even as Sangok bent the water back into his pack and Sokka began hissing out commands, Longshot loosed the arrow. He did not watch or listen to see if the missile would find its mark.

He knew it would.

All of this happened within the span of a few seconds, and even as the sharp, strangled cry of a sentry came down from atop the wall, Sokka was leading them into action.

"They've got firebenders on the wall," he snapped out at just scarcely above a whisper, as gold and crimson sparks began to appear in intervals atop the fortified defensive structure, lighting up the night air as posted sentries and spotters leaped to attention. "We need to get under cover before they decide to start roasting the whole area."

He indicated the barren, stony ground on which they stood, where in the dimly flickering light of the impromptu firebender spotlights they could see the signs of heavy scorching and charring. It was obvious, now, how the Hurricane Horde managed to hold this island so steadfastly against assault.

No wonder they hadn't come across any plant life.

Moving quickly, Sokka led his teammates to duck behind a boulder, but not before they heard someone cry out from atop the wall.

They had been spotted.

Great.

They only narrowly managed to make it behind the large stone before the fireballs started landing at their heels. They were under attack, and dammit all but they would not be able to get back up to the wall without either a hard fight or a crazy plan.

Luckily for their purposes, Sokka happened to specialize in both.

How did they proceed?
111311212.title: It's never that easy

choices: Plan A
Plan B
1113112122.content:
Even as the air hissed and cracked with the rush of fire, the stone behind which they sheltered beginning to grow uncomfortably hot as firebenders pelted it with their element, and lit the unburning ground aflame the the power of their combined bending, Sokka breathed slowly and steadily, eyes closed.

He thought.

"Damn," Sangok muttered, wiping a bead of sweat from his face. "This might just be a new record for things going straight to hell right off the bat."

Longshot gave the waterbender a meaningful look.

Sangok shrugged sheepishly.

"Yeah, I try not to think about that one," he said. "Not the fondest of memories."

The archer nodded in understanding, before turning his attention back to Sokka.

The warrior and strategist was deep in thought, clearly, sweat beading down his face as his lips moved soundlessly, forming silent words at a rate far faster than either of them could begin to read. Even as the night sky glowed red and orange and gold with the flames of the defending sentries, Sokka did not appear to let himself get the least bit perturbed.

At length, after what felt like several excruciatingly long minutes of sheltering behind an uncomfortably hot boulder, flames gradually spreading to all but ring them in, Sokka finally opened his eyes and spoke.

"Longshot, have you got any blasting jelly on you?"

The archer shook his head, silently indicating that if he had, it would have ignited by now in this heat, and they wouldn't be having this discussion.

"Damn," said Sokka weakly. "So much for that plan..." He cast his eyes around, seeing the flames which were slowly encircling them.

"They know we're behind this boulder," he observed, seeing the way the fire was being concentrated on their location, and not just on the general surrounding area. "This specific boulder," he muttered, almost half to himself.

"Well, they saw us run behind it," Sangok said with a shrug. "And they would probably notice it if we move out from behind it."

"Yeah..." said Sokka, a thoughtful expression on his face. "They would..."

Longshot and Sangok glanced at one another, recognizing the tone in their comrade's voice. The former, in particular, knew it quite well.

Sokka grinned, cerulean eyes and ivory teeth flashing dangerously in the firelight.

"I have a plan."

What was it?

Plan A: Beat a hasty retreat from behind the rock, leading the enemy away from the wall and in the direction of their "barrel", only to quickly double back under the cover of darkness and sneak over the wall while the enemy was still distracted.

Plan B: Have Sangok use his waterbending to extinguish the flames, then use the resulting steam to cover their movements as they slipped away and circled around the complex to find some place where they could sneak in.
1113112122.title: Sokka came up with one of his trademark plans

choices: Take Sangok over the wall
Leave Sangok
11131121221.content:
"That wall" Sokka said after describing his plan to his comrade's, his arm pointing towards a small guards hut, but from there they could get inside and away from the immediate sight of the enemy. The three of them stood and ran towards the wall, but 'they' were ready for the trio. Sangok Blocked two blasts of fire with the water he had with them. They were great blasts which meant that his own supply of water was diminished significantly. They continued to run almost there when another blast of fire shot out. Sangok once again moved to extinguish the blast with his own element. He did not see the arrow that had been fired moments later, taking cover behind the blast of fire. The arrow would have struck true were it not for Longshot's dexterity. The master marksman's keen eyes spotted the arrow and he loosed his own projectile, which struck the enemy arrow mid flight, deflecting it away from its prey.

Then the three were behind the wall before another moment passed. "Okay, Sokka said his mind working overtime, to adjust his plan as they witnessed their new surroundings, "We can beat a hasty retreat to the water from here. This hut should give us cover for most of the way there." Longshot nodded, showing his acceptance of the plan. Sangok let out a small sigh "I’m glad you suggested that, my pack is already getting low. It seemed like they were all ready for this new plan. Hearing the ringing of alarm bells, Sokka grimly set his jaw. They had gained the wall, so in that sense the plan had been a success, although he had hoped that they could have gotten in and out without having to engage in combat.

Well, no matter. Sometimes the best solution was the simplest one.

"Longshot," he said, glancing sidelong at the archer, "Do you have enough ammo for a fight?"

The pale, lanky man simply nodded.

Sokka then turned his attention to Sangok.

"How about you?" he asked.

The waterbender flicked his fingers in response, and Sokka could hear a bit a fluid sloshing coming from the camel pack. It wasn't full, or the noise wouldn't have been so evident, but there was still a decent amount inside it. And besides, now that they had gotten inside the complex proper, there would probably be plenty of water to be found here and there stored in pots or jars.

Where there were people, there was water. You couldn't drink straight out of the sea, after all, and this was a small island. To sustain a garrison of this size would require sizable reservoirs of fresh drinking water. And even with the moon as just a thin crescent in the night sky above, Sangok was a damn good waterbender.

Not just anybody could get into Spec Ops.

Sokka nodded.

"Alright," he grunted, pausing only to wipe the sticky, reddish gore off the keen, ebon blade of his jian and then draw his bone war club with his off-hand. "We have a general idea of where they're holding the general, right?" He then nodded, answering his own rhetorical question.

He then paused, chuckling slightly at his unintentional pun, before he continued, his eyes picking out the shapes of enemy soldiers stirring to action down below.

He crouched low on his legs, muscles tensing as he prepared for the leap into danger.

"Watch my back," he said simply, and the two others nodded in understanding. He needed say no more. They understood.

It was time to engage.

Like a ghost, or else a silent beast of prey, Sokka sprang down from the wall into the enemy's midst, and Longshot and Sangok followed him. Like a thing of terror, he descended upon them, and ere any could even react, there were eight new corpses littering the ground.

Three of the newly deceased had a single, black-feathered bolt each sticking from their throat. Three more had their throats cleanly slit, sliced by an edge finer and keener than any of steel or iron. One had a part of his skull caved in by a heavy blow to the back of the head, and the last had two or so feet of black, extraterrestrial steel protruding from her gut.

The defending forces did not have time to assess these injuries personally, however, as they were understandably preoccupied with the presence of the individuals responsible for the deaths.

One soldier drew a pair of broad, curved dao from his back, while another lowered a long, keen spear at the intruders. Two more, coming in for support, punched their fists forward, one shooting forth flame and the other a burst of compressed, swirling air -- one of the rebel airbenders for which the Hurricane Horde had originally gotten its name.

Sangok, reacting quickly, moved his arms, and wall of water -- smaller than he would have liked, but nonetheless sufficient for his purposes -- intercepted the elemental attacks. Most of it burst into steam, but he used his waterbending to quickly cool and condense it back into liquid, which he swirled around his body in a hoop of flowing water.

Longshot fired off two arrows, getting the firebender in the eye, bringing him down. The airbender, however, managed to half-deflect, half-dodge the missile, before making to retaliate with a spinning parkour chop.

Wisely, the three jumped out of the way, narrowly avoiding getting cut in half by the resultant blade of wind -- the airbender's comrades were not so agile, though.

Sokka grimaced, understanding all too well why the Air Nomads traditionally forbade the use of air for attack against living things, and emphasized so strongly on defense -- a competent airbender could easily cut through solid stone with their element, if they focused, and you couldn't really block a blade made of air.

But he did not let this daunt him, and springing forth with a loud cry, he closed the distance between him and the airbender. In a fraction of a second, he was upon his foe, and he raised his weapon high. Gray eyes widened momentarily in surprise, before rolling into the back of the head as the hard, azure ball of a Water Tribe war club was brought down on the unarmored skull with a sickly CRUNCH.

The airbender dropped to the ground, dead.

Sokka, Longshot, and Sangok did not waste any time waiting for reinforcements to arrive.

They came across a few more enemies as they made their way to the prison near the heart of the compound, but between Sokka's weapons, Longshot's aim, and Sangok's waterbending, none of them stood a chance.

Soon, they were inside the prison building, cutting down the few remaining guards who had not been permitted to leave their posts to respond to the alarm.

Then they began their search. Did they find General Jeong-Jeong?

Sokka breathed a sigh of relief when the finally found their target. The elderly, but undeniably skilled and cunning firebending general, was by his hands and feet to the wall, behind bars, dressed only in rags. The man looked like he had lost some weight during captivity, but not too much.

Either the Horde had fed him relatively well, for a POW, or the stories about the man's aptitude for meditation were far less exaggerated than Sokka would have thought. Being able to spend up to days at a time in a meditative trance could probably be very useful in Jeong-Jeong's predicament.

Without need for prompting, Sangok used his waterbending to freeze the lock on the cell door, and then shatter it.

The noise was just loud enough to draw the grizzled White Lotus general's attention.

"Sokka Mawii'aa, I presume?" said Jeong-Jeong gruffly, tersely, cracking open a single eye to survey the specialist. "I was expecting you sooner than this."

"We ran into some trouble," was all Sokka said, before walking into the cell using his sword to deftly cut the chains from the firebender's manacles.

Jeong-Jeong, free to move once more, stood up with little difficulty. He did not seem to have nearly as much trouble moving as Sokka might have expected from an ordinary person, but then leadership of the White Lotus armies were just about anything but ordinary.

"I assume you have arranged a way to get us off of this island?" the general inquired dryly, massaging his sore wrists.

"Jet and Haru should be taking care of it as we speak," interjected Sangok, and Jeong-Jeong nodded.

"Very well, then," he said. "Let us depart, before anyone catches wise to us."

But then a voice spoke from behind them.

"Oh, but I already have."

"Hahn," he spat the word like an exceptional vile curse, icy blue eyes narrowing nearly to slits as he glared at the traitorous Northern Water Tribe commander.

"Mawii'aa," said the young man, who appeared to be roughly Sokka's age. He was handsome, or at least he would have been, if not for the gruesome, jagged scar which ran diagonally across his face, from his temple to the side of his chin, running between his eyes and through his nose (from which a good chunk was missing). He was sneering at Sokka, and solely at Sokka.

On either side, he was flanked by three soldiers -- four were equipped with waterbending camel packs, similar to Sangok's, and the other two each bore a long, thin, wooden staffs in a fashion like yet unlike that of the Air Nomads.

"You're certainly looking as charming as ever," said Sokka snidely, darkly, in attempt to temper the ice cold hate flowing through his veins with wit and sarcasm.

Hahn snarled, raising a hand to the scar on his face.

"Don't think I have forgotten, Mawii'aa," the young commander hissed, spitting out Sokka's family name like it was a piece of rancid meat. "Don't think that I will ever forget what you took from me," he murmured coldly.

His eyes were on Sokka, and Sokka alone. And Sokka's eyes were likewise focused exclusively on Hahn. The two glared hatefully at one another, seeming each to see only the other.

"Yue chose me," said Sokka lowly, after a long moment of silence. As far as he was concerned, he and Hahn were the only ones present in the building. "And you attacked me. It was self defense."

Hahn's face contorted angrily, the scar appearing even more hideous as fury leaped from his eyes like sparking flames.

"She chose poorly, then," he growled, a hand reaching to his side, where hung a jian of the same fashion as Sokka's. "Philandering coward," he hissed, drawing the sword to reveal that its blade was also black, the stone-sister of Sokka's Space Sword, forged by the same smith, from the same rare alloy. "I will end you."

He swung, and Sokka raised his own blade in response. The swords clashed in a shower of sparks, but neither warrior flinched.

1113112122221111.content:
Sokka and Hahn were both skilled, as swordsmen, warriors, and strategists. Both were men of the Water Tribe, proud and strong, and resourceful and cunning. They were, in many ways, cut from the same mold, mirror opposites of one another.

In another time, perhaps, they could have been friends, at least or rivals, but not here, not now. No, there was too much blood between them, and they were on opposite sides of a war, besides. They were bitter foes. They hated each other.

But Hahn's hate was hot and fiery, wild and undirected. When Yue left him for Sokka, he lost something, the part of himself that had made him a decent human being. He had attempted to take her back by force, to kill Yue's lover and bind her to himself forevermore, to chain her to him so she could never again leave.

Hahn had let his anger consume him, and Sokka had easily stopped him, had easily cut his face with that damned black sword. He had betrayed his people, embittered and filled with a formless, writhing hatred.

Sokka, in that way, was NOT like Hahn. He hated the man, yes, but his was a cold hate, as cold as the eternal glaciers of his ancestral homeland. It was as sharp as his sword, carefully honed, at directed solely at Hahn. His hate was the hate of good man who witnesses another commit unimaginable evil, and realizes that this person must be stopped. It was impersonal, rational, calculated.

Anger did not consume Sokka. Not in battle. It may have fueled his strength, may have lent power to his limbs, but it did not rule him. No, Sokka was a clever man, more intelligent by far than most would give him credit. He saw his anger as a tool, a resource to be used, a means to an end.

He used his anger. It did not use him.

While Hahn swung wildly, bringing his sword to bear with all of his not inconsiderable strength, a hot, burning wrath writ upon his face, Sokka coolly sidestepped, and thrust his blade forth with precisely the amount of force needed to penetrate -- no more, and no less.

Space Sword slipped between Hahn's ribs, its slender, lethally pointed blade piercing through skin and muscle and cloth and steel like they weren't even there.

It stabbed through his heart.

Hahn was already dead, even if he hadn't accepted it yet.

Eyes widening, the commander, feeling the steel in his chest, and perhaps knowing the certainty of his fate, nonetheless made one final, desperate, hateful attack. Even as his life force swiftly ebbed and his limbs became as lead, Hahn took one last swing with his sword before Death could take him fully into its icy embrace.

It happened in a flash of gleaming obsidian, and a spray of liquid ruby. Sokka's eyes widened, feeling a warmth on his chest.

Even as the light left Hahn's eyes for the final time, Sokka raised a hand to his chest, feeling something hot, wet, and sticky. Bringing the hand away, he saw a brown, calloused palm stained with red.

His vision blurred, and the room seemed to spin around him.

The world went black.

Katara then said to him, "Sokka, you never win, why do you keep spending money on it?"

Sokka then said to her as the tv was announcing the numbers, "Sh, sh, sh you are less important right now."

Katara huffed and crossed her arms as the man said on the screen the numbers, "5, 8, 9, 4 and the final number."

Sokka was holding a fox rabbit's foot and crossing his fingers as he repeatedly whispered the number 1. The man then said to the audience, "The final number is 1, we have a winner. Sokka Mawii'aa is this bi-months winner of the $428,316,000 yuan prize. Congratulations Mr. Mawii'aa."
1153.title: Sokka

info.brief_description: Decide on either being Sokka,ZukoOrAang with their harem in their big house.Adult content.
info.description:
Alright, this is a story I posted on my FF.net account and was told it was too good to just leave in the hands of one person. So, here it is, the story is about Zuko, Sokka and Aang buying a house 4 years ago. They moved in with their first girl friends and wives. Now, four years later their lives continue. The first chapter shall be the main story line and then you get to pick which guy's adventure you will follow. So, there will only a few rules.

1. No killing main characters.

2. No male character (Zuko, Aang or Sokka) shall only have one girl. The idea is that this is a mixed marriage.

3. Orgies are the idea, try to keep it that way. If some yaoi is seen, then it's seen. I have no qualm on yaoi or yuri. It's not for everyone just like straight is not for everyone.

4. Try to have more than just sex or lemons in the story.

5. Once you pick a route stick with it. You can't go on the Zuko route and then just switch it up to Sokka. You pick one guy on the route and that's it. Less you pick the expand canon route. Then that's a different story.
